fastapi/params.py:Path:138.description: Declares a path parameter for FastAPI route endpoints. Path parameters are extracted from the URL path and passed to the endpoint function with automatic type conversion and validation.
fastapi/params.py:Path:138.summary: Path parameter declaration for URL path segments
fastapi/params.py:Path:138.purpose: Enable declarative path parameter extraction with validation

fastapi/params.py:Query:222.description: Declares a query parameter for FastAPI route endpoints. Query parameters are URL parameters after the ? mark. Provides validation, type conversion, default values, and automatic OpenAPI documentation.
fastapi/params.py:Query:222.summary: Query parameter declaration for URL query strings
fastapi/params.py:Query:222.purpose: Enable declarative query parameter extraction with validation

fastapi/params.py:Header:304.description: Declares an HTTP header parameter for FastAPI endpoints. Automatically converts header names from snake_case to HTTP header format. Useful for authentication tokens, content negotiation, and custom header extraction.
fastapi/params.py:Header:304.purpose: Extract values from HTTP request headers

fastapi/params.py:Cookie:384.description: Declares a cookie parameter for FastAPI endpoints. Extracts values from HTTP cookies with automatic type conversion and validation support.
fastapi/params.py:Cookie:384.purpose: Extract and validate cookie values from requests

fastapi/params.py:Body:463.description: Declares a request body parameter for FastAPI endpoints. Used for extracting JSON data from POST/PUT requests with Pydantic validation.
fastapi/params.py:Body:463.purpose: Extract and validate request body data

fastapi/applications.py:FastAPI:44.description: The main FastAPI application class for building modern APIs. Provides automatic OpenAPI documentation, request validation, dependency injection, and high performance through async support. Built on Starlette for web handling and Pydantic for data validation.
fastapi/applications.py:FastAPI:44.purpose: Create high-performance API applications with automatic documentation

fastapi/routing.py:APIRouter:473.description: Groups related routes together for modular API organization. Allows organizing your API into logical modules that can be included in the main FastAPI application. Supports prefix paths, tags, dependencies, and response overrides.
fastapi/routing.py:APIRouter:473.summary: Route grouping for modular API design
fastapi/routing.py:APIRouter:473.purpose: Organize related endpoints into reusable modules

fastapi/routing.py:APIRoute:199.description: Represents a single API endpoint route definition. Handles request processing, dependency injection, validation, and response serialization. Most users interact with routes through decorators (@app.get, @app.post) rather than directly.

fastapi/exception_handlers.py:http_excep.description: Default handler for HTTP exceptions in FastAPI. Converts HTTPException instances into proper JSON error responses with appropriate status codes. Can be overridden for custom error formatting.
fastapi/exception_handlers.py:http_excep.purpose: Convert exceptions to JSON error responses

fastapi/exception_handlers.py:request_va.description: Handler for request validation errors. Formats Pydantic validation errors into user-friendly JSON responses with detailed field-level error messages.
fastapi/exception_handlers.py:request_va.purpose: Format validation errors for API responses

fastapi/security/oauth2.py:OAuth2Passwor.description: OAuth2 password flow authentication for token-based auth. Extracts bearer tokens from the Authorization header and integrates with OpenAPI documentation. Use with a dependency to protect routes.
Form data class for OAuth2 password grant requests. Provides username, password, scope, and other standard OAuth2 fields for login endpoints.
fastapi/security/oauth2.py:OAuth2Passwor.purpose: Parse OAuth2 password grant login requests

fastapi/responses.py:JSONResponse:10.description: JSON response class for returning JSON data. Serializes Python objects to JSON and sets the appropriate Content-Type header. Supports custom status codes, headers, and media types.

fastapi/responses.py:HTMLResponse:12.description: HTML response class for returning HTML content. Sets the Content-Type to text/html. Useful for serving HTML pages or templates.

fastapi/encoders.py:jsonable_encoder:33.description: Converts Python objects to JSON-serializable format. Handles Pydantic models, datetime objects, UUIDs, and other complex types. Essential for preparing data for JSON responses.
fastapi/encoders.py:jsonable_encoder:33.purpose: Convert complex Python objects for JSON serialization
